item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Explains New 5.7 Game Mode
item.description:
Summary

  • Leak hints at the new Genshin Impact game mode in Version 5.7 with Ley Line Disorders and escalating difficulty.
  • Players can choose difficulty levels and receive rewards for all lower levels if they beat a higher challenge.
  • Fans are excited for update 5.7 with new characters Skirk and Dahlia, praising HoYoverse for rewarding Resin use.

A new Genshin Impact leak has revealed tons of details about a new game mode that will arrive in the upcoming Version 5.7. Since Genshin Impact 's release back in 2020, players have been asking for new permanent game modes that will keep them occupied once they finish the new content that arrives with every update.

The most popular domain in the game is probably the Spiral Abyss, which has players battle through 12 different levels, also known as floors, each much harder than the previous one. Over the last couple of weeks, rumors have suggested that Genshin Impact will add a similar permanent game mode in the upcoming months.

A credible leaker named Team Mew has finally revealed more details about a new game mode called Purging Rebellious Calamity, which should may arrive in the upcoming Genshin Impact Version 5.7. According to the leak, at the start of the challenge, players will need to choose a difficulty level, and more Ley Line Disorders will appear with higher difficulty, making the enemies much harder to beat. If players manage to beat a higher difficulty challenge, they will receive rewards for that difficulty and all the lower levels. This means that players won't have to battle their way through all of the levels. Once they enter the challenge, players will need to complete three consecutive battles, and defeating all enemies across the three stages will count as completing the challenge.

Genshin Impact Leaks Details About New Permanent Game Mode

The leak also revealed that for the first 10 days after the challenge starts, Chaotic Ley Line points will be in a "bursting state." Players with AR 45 and above who complete the challenge on Dire difficulty or higher can use their Resin to activate a special Chaotic Ley Line Blossom and have their rewards multiplied. Many players are praising HoYoverse for granting rewards for multiple lower levels if a higher difficulty challenge is completed, especially considering that the rewards can be tied to Resin in Genshin Impact .

Some people are still wondering how the enemy lineup will reset in this new challenge and hope that it will overlap with the Spiral Abyss. This domain used to reset twice a month, but with the arrival of other permanent game modes such as Genshin Impact 's Imaginarium Theater, the number of resets was reduced to once a month. Players suspect that the new game mode and the Spiral Abyss could function similarly to how Memory of Chaos and Pure Fiction work in Honkai: Star Rail .

Overall, fans seem very satisfied with the rumors about update 5.7, as recent beta data revealed that it will also contain two new Genshin Impact characters, Skirk and Dahlia. Both of these have already been officially revealed, and it's highly unlikely that there will be a third roster addition.

Step into Teyvat, a vast world teeming with life and flowing with elemental energy.

You and your sibling arrived here from another world. Separated by an unknown god, stripped of your powers, and cast into a deep slumber, you now awake to a world very different from when you first arrived.

Thus begins your journey across Teyvat to seek answers from The Seven the gods of each element. Along the way, prepare to explore every inch of this wondrous world, join forces with a diverse range of characters, and unravel the countless mysteries that Teyvat holds...

item.title: Call of Duty 2025s Rumored Battle Pass Change is a Controversy Waiting to Happen
item.description:
The Call of Duty franchise's core formula has evolved quite a lot over the years, with this playing a large part in how the series has remained so consistently popular. Away from the singleplayer offerings of a given CoD title, the franchise's core multiplayer has faced many of these sweeping changes, with Call of Duty leaning heavily into the increasingly popular model of live service content in recent years.

This live service approach now defines the modern post-launch lifecycle of Call of Duty , with in-game seasons bringing waves of content through new maps, weapons, perks, limited-time modes, and much more. Of course, these seasons are also defined by their own battle passes, with CoD now offering a range of rewards through varied tiers of freely available or paid-for battle pass variants. Rumors are starting to circulate regarding some changes that may come to CoD 's battle pass system for its 2025 release, with players potentially being locked out of content that previously did not require battle pass ownership - something that will undoubtedly stir up a lot of controversy if it proves true.

Call of Duty's Rumored Battle Pass Changes Could Cause a Surge of Negativity

The post-launch popularity of any modern Call of Duty title ebbs and flows alongside its in-game seasons, with the fresh content that these seasons bring needing to meet the demands and expectations of the playerbase. Battle passes are often a good reflection of how memorable a given season is, with Call of Duty already taking some bold approaches in terms of how players can engage with them.

While players can earn some in-game rewards for free by leveling up a season's battle pass, they will have to purchase the pass to enjoy the vast majority of its benefits, with CoD also featuring a BlackCell premium pass that acts as a step above the standard battle pass purchase option. These BlackCell passes offer eye-catching variants of the operator skins from a given season, with multiple purchase options for a single battle pass already being quite a contentious element of Call of Duty 's modern monetization approach.

The standard battle pass for a Black Ops 6 season costs roughly $10, while the BlackCell version costs nearly $30 thanks to its tier skips and exclusive items.

The scrutiny that exists around CoD 's battle pass system is only set to grow if recent rumors hold weight, with it being suggested that 2025's CoD entry may completely change what kind of content is locked behind a battle pass purchase. Supposedly, Activision is looking to incentivize players to purchase seasonal battle passes in 2025's Call of Duty project by locking certain limited-time modes behind premium battle passes, and the potential backlash that this may cause is obvious.

CoD's Rumored Battle Pass Changes Could Sour One of the Franchise's Best Forms of Post-Launch Content

Seasonal events and limited-time modes have been a defining part of Black Ops 6 's post-launch multiplayer life, often offering an engaging level of themed variety away from the usual gameplay of the title, with these limited-time modes never being behind a form of paywall and being available to all players. It is further alleged that higher-valued operator skins and other content will move over to battle passes instead of Premium Event Passes, with it being unclear if this will increase the price of battle passes or create a new tier altogether.

This rumored move would essentially strong-arm players out of some of the most important post-launch multiplayer content that modern CoD titles possess, instead aggressively pushing them toward battle pass purchases. With it seeming increasingly likely that 2025's Call of Duty entry will have to directly contend with Battlefield 6 , these rumored battle pass changes could prove to be a grave error on Activision's part, with the backlash that Pass-exclusive LTMs would cause likely being intense and inevitable. After all, it is hard to imagine players not being frustrated that they are locked out of content for a paid game if they do not pay an additional fee every few months, and the controversy would only grow worse if these modes provided increased XP gains, as pay-to-win accusations would be inevitable.

item.title: Is Unlocking The Vendetta Perk in Black Ops 6 Worth It?
item.description:
Season 3 Reloaded of Black Ops 6 rounds out the last few content drops of the season before Season 4 rolls out, bringing forth the second half of the maps for Multiplayer with the release of Signal and Haven, along with the release of Directed Mode for the Shattered Veil in Zombies. Additional armaments also arrive with this update, like the Ladra Submachine Gun.

On the topic of additional loadout options, two notable Season 3 events have introduced even more choices that players can run in Multiplayer, like the Goblin MK2 7.62 Mini-Rocket Conversion. An additional Multiplayer Perk also entered the frayone that gives players a subtle advantage in making a comeback after being eliminated. Here is how to unlock the Vendetta Perk in Black Ops 6 , along with what it does.

How To Unlock The Vendetta Perk In Black Ops 6

To unlock the Vendetta Perk, players will need to claim it using Blaze Bucks earned during the limited-time Blaze of Glory Event in Black Ops 6 and Warzone . Blaze Bucks are a unique drop that can spawn from eliminations in Multiplayer or Zombies, as well as from Supply Caches in Warzone . Once players have enough, spending 20 Blaze Bucks on the eighth mystery reward via the Blaze of Glory Event page will unlock the Vendetta Perk for Multiplayer.

The Blaze of Glory Event is currently scheduled to end on May 15 at 10 AM PT. Once it ends, the Vendetta Perk will become an Armory Unlock for those who did not acquire it during the event's runtime.

What Does The Vendetta Perk Do In Black Ops 6?

Vendetta is a Recon Combat Specialty-based Perk that players can equip in their Perk 2 or Perk Greed slot in their Multiplayer loadouts. When equipped, if the user is eliminated, their killers last known position will be marked on their HUD for a short duration. If players successfully eliminate their killer, they will receive bonus score for doing so.

While serving as a great strategy for making a quick comeback after being eliminated, the Vendetta Perk is easily countered by the Vigilance Perk, which renders the user immune to its effects. The Vendetta Perks ability to reveal players also only lasts for a few seconds, making it more reliable on smaller-scale maps but generally not all that useful on large-scale maps. While unlocking the Perk itself is relatively easy, there are a few other Perk 2 Perks that players may be better off using.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 6: Things Confirmed by GTA 6 Trailer 2
item.description:
Summary

  • Rockstar has delayed GTA 6 to May 2026, disappointing many fans.
  • New characters, celebrity talent, and a variety of music genres are showcased in the second trailer.
  • GTA 6 expands Vice City, offering districts, wildlife, nightlife, mini-games, various vehicles, and weapon options.

As soon as Grand Theft Auto 5 was released in 2013, fans knew a sequel would come. They probably didnt know it would take over a decade, though. Grand Theft Auto 6 s first trailer was released in 2024, which promised a nebulous 2025 release date. However, Rockstar announced that the game was getting delayed into May of 2026, which was a big bummer for a lot of fans, especially since this news came with no new images or trailers.

But, to keep the hype alive, Rockstar dropped a new trailer that has been heating up the news once again. With so much going on in said trailer, however, it can be hard for viewers to keep up. As such, here's a detailed look at what has been confirmed by GTA 6 Trailer 2 .

5 Celebrity Talent Is Brewing

And So Too Is The Music

One of the new characters introduced in this second GTA 6 trailer is Brian. Jason rents a house from Brian and works for him by picking up renter checks and doing drug runs. His voice actor seems to be Stephen Root, though it has not been officially announced yet. Roots voice is very distinct; most may recognize it as Bill from King of the Hill or Fuches from Barry .

Another new character, Cal, seems like he is voiced by former SNL star Bobby Moynihan, although that feels less than 100% compared to Root. Finally, several songs can be heard in the trailer besides the track Hot Together by The Pointer Sisters being played. They include Child Support by Zenglen, Everybody Have Fun Tonight by Wang Chung, and Talkin to Myself Again by Tammy Wynette. Radio stations have always been a big part of the Grand Theft Auto series, so while flipping through tunes doesn't reveal anything wild, it is still nice to see that Rockstar is providing players with a variety of musical genres.

4 There Are Districts

It Goes Beyond Vice City

Old Grand Theft Auto games were purely focused on one city. The game that changed it all was Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas , which featured multiple areas beyond the hustle and bustle of city life in Los Santos. Grand Theft Auto 5 reused this region and expanded it by a huge degree. Now, Grand Theft Auto 6 gets to expand Vice City by offering regions beyond the beachfront.

In the trailer, fans can see snippets of Ambrosia, Grassrivers, Leonida Keys, and Port Gellhorn, all of which are highlighted better with screenshots on Rockstars website. Even cooler, theres Mount Kalaga National Park, which should feature tons of wildlife, as deer and big cats are shown in the screenshots. There should be plenty of other animals in the game, too, from snakes to gators. Because this part of the world features so many creatures, it would not be hard to imagine Grand Theft Auto 6 players being able to hunt animals like in Red Dead Redemption 2 , although that may be a step too far.

3 There Are Many Ways To Enjoy The Nightlife

It Seems That Several Mini-Games Will Be Available, Too

Los Santos was a party city since it was based on L.A./Hollywood, but Vice City and its surrounding areas look even wilder. The trailer and screenshots show a lot of locations where players can enjoy some nightlife and perhaps even participate in a few mini-games. Some clubs include Jack of Hearts, Nine1Nine, and Delights Cabaret. Theres a big stadium shown in the trailer, including a shot of a Ferris Wheel that would also be fun to explore.

Screenshots and the trailer highlight characters enjoying pool, mini-golf, dirt bike racing, scuba diving, lifting weights, and training at the gym. Some of those sportier activities could mean that the RPG elements from Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas are returning in GTA 6 , which would be huge. The one thing Grand Theft Auto 6 probably won't take from Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas , though, is the ability to eat non-stop and get huge like CJ could. It would be funny to see Jason and Lucia pull heists in different forms, though.

2 There Are Tons Of Vehicles To Try Out

Get Around Vice City In Style

Grand Theft Auto was built on one huge mechanic: the ability to steal cars. As the series went on, more vehicles were added, and Grand Theft Auto 6 features a ton in the new media rollout. There is a standard variety of current cars and trucks, both tricked out with bling or hydraulics.

There are various watercrafts, including airboats, speedboats, yachts, jet skis, and most exciting of all, kayaks. Then, there are helicopters and planes for those who love flight in their open-world games. While not confirmed, there are several shots of Jason jumping from one car to another, which may mean that this is a mechanic rather than just a cutscene opportunity.

1 Players Will Have Access To A Fun Range Of Weapons

Starting A New Life With Force

While not a weapon-heavy trailer, there are a few to point out. Several characters can be seen sporting standard pistols and revolvers. Lucia at one point is holding some kind of SMG, and there are scoped rifles to be seen with some of the hunters in the game.

The in-game Ammu-Nation ad showcases a plethora of shotguns on the wall along with assault rifles and machine guns. The aforementioned gym scene could also mean that hand-to-hand combat could have been improved. Melee combat has never been that intricate in the Grand Theft Auto series, so now would be a good time to change that. Either way, Jason and Lucia should have more than enough firepower to take the world on.

item.title: Best Weapons For Ifa In Genshin Impact
item.description:
Finding the best weapons for characters in Genshin Impact is crucial to increasing their stats and finding passives that work with their kits. Thats the case with Ifa, who needs weapons that maximize his Elemental Mastery (EM) and make every Swirl reaction count.

Since thats the only requirement to build a strong Ifa, players might find it easy to find the best weapon for Ifa in Genshin Impact . In terms of his weapon of choice, Ifa uses a Catalyst as a weapon, similar to characters like Kazuha and Wanderer.

5 Sacrificial Fragments

Base Stat

454 Base ATK

Sub-stat

221 Elemental Mastery

R5 Effect

After dealing damage to an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 80% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 16s.

Sacrificial Fragments is one of the best 4-star weapons for Ifa in Genshin Impact . The 4-star Catalyst increases Ifas Elemental Mastery by 221 from its Sub-stat. Its always nice to have a 4-star weapon that grants this amount of stats for its wielding character.

On the other hand, Ifa doesnt benefit from the weapons passive effect since its designed to allow him to cast his Elemental Skill again, and Ifa doesnt need that. By the time Ifa is done with his Elemental Skill duration, its better to start the teams rotation instead of going for another ride.

4 Starcaller's Watch

Base Stat

542 Base ATK

Sub-stat

265 Elemental Mastery

Effect

Increases Elemental Mastery by 100. Gain the "Mirror of Night" effect within 15s after the equipping character creates a shield: The current active party member deals 28% increased DMG to nearby opponents. You can gain the "Mirror of Night" effect once every 14s.

Starcaller's Watch is one of the best weapons for any character that needs Elemental Mastery. Thats certainly the case with Ifa, since he needs a lot of EM, and Starcaller's Watch grants him that. Ifa gets 265 EM from the 5-star Catalysts Sub-stat on top of another 100 from its passive effect. Sadly, this is where Starcaller's Watch's help ends, since the rest of the passive effect requires Ifa to shield, and he doesnt have that in his kit.

3 A Thousand Floating Dreams

Base Stat

542 Base ATK

Sub-stat

265 Elemental Mastery

Effect

Party members other than the equipping character will provide the equipping character with buffs based on whether their Elemental Type is the same as the latter or not. If their Elemental Types are the same, increase Elemental Mastery by 32. If not, increase the equipping character's DMG Bonus from their Elemental Type by 10%. Each of the aforementioned effects can have up to 3 stacks. Additionally, all nearby party members other than the equipping character will have their Elemental Mastery increased by 40. Multiple such effects from multiple such weapons can stack.

Similar to Starcaller's Watch, A Thousand Floating Dreams gives Ifa a lot of Elemental Mastery, and its a very good choice for him. The only downside is that Ifa doesnt get a lot from the weapons passive since the requirement is to have other Anemo characters in the team to further buff Ifas EM. However, A Thousand Floating Dreams can still buff the teams Elemental Mastery, which should increase their Elemental reactions in Genshin Impact .

2 Hakushin Ring

Base Stat

565 Base ATK

Sub-stat

30.6% Energy Recharge

R5 Effect

After the character equipped with this weapon triggers an Electro elemental reaction, nearby party members of an Elemental Type involved in the elemental reaction receive a 20% Elemental DMG Bonus for their element, lasting 6s. Elemental Bonuses gained in this way cannot be stacked.

Hakushin Ring is an amazing weapon for Ifa in Genshin Impact . Instead of buffing Ifas Elemental Mastery, players can build Ifa with a Catalyst that will increase the teams DMG as Ifa is Swirling and shredding enemies resistance. Its double the benefits for a small DMG trade-off.

1 Sunny Morning Sleep-In

Base Stat

542 Base ATK

Sub-stat

265 Elemental Mastery

Effect

Elemental Mastery increases by 120 for 6s after triggering Swirl. Elemental Mastery increases by 96 for 9s after the wielder's Elemental Skill hits an opponent. Elemental Mastery increases by 32 for 30s after the wielder's Elemental Burst hits an opponent.

Having a weapon like Sunny Morning Sleep-In for Ifa is amazing since the 5-star Catalyst grants him Elemental Mastery on top of Elemental Mastery passive with some Elemental Mastery on the side. The weapon is purely made to absolutely skyrocket a characters EM, and it works with units like Ifa, who heavily depend on the stat in Genshin Impact .
